ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: He said, 'By the truth - and I speak the truth -
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: (God) said: "This is right by Me, and what I say is right.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: He (i.e. Allah) said: “This is the Truth -- and I only speak the Truth --
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: The Lord said, "I swear by the Truth - and I speak the Truth -
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: Said Allah, “So this is the truth; and I speak only the truth.” –
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: (Allah) said: "The truth is -- the truth I say - "
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: He said: The truth then is and the truth do I speak:
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: Said He, 'This is the truth, and the truth I say;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: He said: The Truth is, and the Truth I speak,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: God said, "This is the truth, I speak only the truth,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Allah said: the truth is, and it is the truth that I speak, -
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: Said He, ‘The truth is that—and I speak the truth—
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: (Allah) said: "Then it is just and fitting- and I say what is just and fitting-
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: (Allah) said: "The Truth is, and the Truth I say,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: He (Allah) said: 'This is the truth, and I speak the truth:
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: He said, “The truth is, and I say the truth.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: [Allah] said, "The truth [is My oath], and the truth I say -
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [38:84] He said, ‘So the truth is — and the truth I [always] speak (read both [words] in the accusative [fa’l-haqqa wa’l-haqqa]; or with the first in the nominative and the second in the accusative because of the verb [aqūlu, ‘I speak’] that follows. As for reading the first one in the accusative, this would be on account of the mentioned verb [qāla, ‘he said’]; but it is also said to be on account of its being a verbal noun, the sense being uhiqqu l-haqqa, ‘I establish the truth’; or [it is in the accusative by implication] if the particle for the oath [fa] is removed. It [the first haqq] could also be in the nominative because of its being the subject of a missing predicate, as in fa’l-haqqu minnī, ‘truth [comes] from Me’. It is also said that [the sentence means] fa’l-haqqu qasamī, ‘the truth is [this] oath from Me’, the response to which is the following [la-amla’anna …]) —
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (He said) Allah said to him: (The Truth is) I am the Truth, (and the Truth I speak,
